In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here's a Julia function called `wrap_string` that wraps text to a given width while adding a newline after each wrap:

```julia
function wrap_string(text, text_width::Int = 10)
    lines = []
    
    for line in split(text, '\n')
        if length(line) > text_width
            push!(lines, line[1:text_width])
            push!(lines, "\n")
        else
            push!(lines, line)
        end
    end
    
    return join(lines)
end

# Example usage:
text = "This is a very long string that needs to be wrapped to a maximum text_width of 10 characters. Let's see the result."
wrapped_text = wrap_string(text, 10)
println(wrapped_text)
```

In this example, we provide a longer text and set `text_width` to 10 characters. The function wraps the text accordingly, adding new lines when necessary.
